column1: 1. Description of methods used for collection/generation of data:
column3: 3. Instrument- or software-specific information needed to interpret the data:

column1: Mice were injected with either astrocyte-TurboID or astrocyte-tdTomato AAV. Each mouse received 3 doses of biotin (24 mg/kg) over 24 hours. All mice also received a single injection of PBS (24 mg/kg) 24 hours before culling
column2: Raw files were analyzed with DIANN software (1.8.1) using the following parameters:

column1: Mice were culled by cervical dislocation and cortex hemispheres were dissected and flash frozen in liquid nitrogen. Samples were stored at -80C until proteins were isolated.
column2: Spectra were analysed with library-free DIA (double-pass) using a Uniprot mouse FASTA file that included tdTomato and streptavidin and a library of known contaminants for in-silico digest
column3: Analysis Software: DIANN and custom analyses in R

column1: Biotinylated proteins from the cortex were isolated using streptavidin coated beads.
column2: "report.pg_matrix" file from DIANN output containing protein quantifications was used for downstream analysis

column1: Isolated biotinylated proteins were digested into peptides via on-bead digestion with trypsin+Lys-C.
column2: Custom R script was used to clean up the data:

column1: 10% of each isolated peptide sample was injected into the mass spec.
column2: a. Removed ambiguous proteins (contains ";" in Protein.Group)
b. Dropped proteins without a gene name
c. Removed keratins, other cRAP (https://www.thegpm.org/crap/), and non-mouse proteins by searching against custom library of Crap_IDs
d. Excluded proteins found in 2 or fewer samples (irrespective of AAV)
e. Normalised proteins by quantile normalisation.
f. All NA values (i.e., no protein detected) were imputed as 0 for differential expression analysis
